title: UK minsters 'stood on sidelines as Thomas Cook bosses were offered overseas government help'
text:
Thomas Cook’s former bosses have attacked ministers for standing on the sidelines as it raced to secure lifeline funding - while other European countries scrambled to offer support.

Appearing in front of MPs on Tuesday, chief executive Peter Fankhauser revealed ministers from Germany, Spain, Turkey, Bulgaria and Greece had personally contacted him to offer support in the days before the world-renowned travel company collapsed.

In sharp contrast, Mr Fankhauser had just one meeting with Transport Secretary Grant Shapps on Sept 9, leaving negotiations to lower ranking officials as the business went down.
